definition: Learners evaluating each other's work, developing critical analysis and communication skills

positive_examples: Exchange papers with a partner and use the rubric to provide feedback.
Peer review helps you see your work through others' eyes.
Give specific, constructive feedback on two strengths and two areas for improvement.
Learning to evaluate others' work develops your own critical thinking.
negative_examples: Only the teacher will read your essay.
Your grade is based solely on my evaluation.
training_hints.disambiguation: Peers evaluate each other, not just teacher evaluation
